Ambiguity.definition: The fundamental condition of human existence where one is both a free subject (consciousness) and an object in the world (body/facticity). It is the tension between freedom and constraint, transcendence and immanence.
Ambiguity.excerpt: The tragic ambiguity of the human condition lies in this: that each of us is a sovereign subject, an absolute consciousness, and yet we are also an object for others, a thing among things in the world.

The Other.definition: A concept used to describe how a dominant group (Subject) defines a subordinate group (Object) as fundamentally different and inferior. Specifically used to analyze the oppression of women.
The Other.excerpt: For centuries, woman has been defined as the 'Other'. Man is the Subject, the Absolute; she is the Object. She is defined not by who she is, but by her relation to man.

Transcendence.definition: The act of going beyond the given situation, reaching towards the future through projects and actions. It is the expression of human freedom.
Transcendence.excerpt: Freedom is not a given; it is a conquest. It is the constant movement of transcending what is towards what is not yet.

Immanence.definition: The state of being stuck in the present, in repetitive tasks, or being treated as an object/thing. It is the denial of transcendence.
Immanence.excerpt: It forces woman to live in a state of immanence, trapped in the repetition of daily life, while man claims the realm of transcendence, of action and creation.

The Serious Man.definition: A type of person who denies their own freedom by accepting values as external, absolute facts given by authority or society, rather than human creations.
The Serious Man.excerpt: One can choose to retreat into the 'serious' world, to pretend that values are absolute and externalâ€”this is what I call the 'sub-man' or the 'serious man'.

Becoming.definition: The process of self-creation through social conditioning and personal choice. Rejects biological determinism.
Becoming.excerpt: One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman.
